question_sentence: According to climate think tank Ember, how many of the 133 Cop28 nations have increased their renewable energy targets since the summit?
evidence: In the two years since the landmark climate summit, only a handful of nations have acted on their pledge to triple global renewables capacity by 2030. Only 22 countries have adjusted their renewable energy targets since the 2023 conference, and six of those who did reduced their goal.

question_sentence: Tesla has struck a deal with which electronics giant to make its semiconductor chips?
evidence: The Texas plant where Samsung is expected to produce the chips isn't due to open until 2026, but Tesla CEO Elon Musk has already hailed the deal – worth $16.5 billion – saying its "strategic importance" is "hard to overstate".

question_sentence: England beat which nation on Sunday to win the 2025 women's Euros?
evidence: England beat La Roja on penalties following a 1-1 draw in the final, with Arsenal forward Chloe Kelly's strike winning the shootout. The victory in Basel means the Lionesses hold on to their title as champions of Europe. The team were welcomed home with a victory parade in central London on Wednesday, cheered on by an estimated 65,000 well-wishers.

question_sentence: What is the French resort town of Les Sables d’Olonne in the Vendée region cracking down on?
evidence: Les Sables d'Olonne is cracking down on shirtlessness. Officials will fine people who walk around "half naked" anywhere other than the beach, according to a Facebook post by its mayor, Yannick Moreau, who calls it a matter of "respect for locals".

question_sentence: A woman in Ohio has given birth to a baby that was grown from an embryo frozen in what year?
evidence: Lindsey and Tim Pierce welcomed a healthy son, Thaddeus, whose "life" began more than 30 years ago as one of several embryos created for Linda Archerd and her husband, who were undergoing IVF. Archerd, now 62 and a grandmother, became pregnant via one of the embryos, with the others stored until she donated one to the Pierces for their own fertility treatment.

question_sentence: A Massachusetts court has ruled that the Trump administration can't withhold federal funds from what body?
evidence: A federal judge in Massachusetts ruled on Monday that the Trump administration can't withhold Medicaid funds from the reproductive health organisation, which also provides abortions, under a provision of the recently passed Republican "big, beautiful" megabill.

question_sentence: Which app, where women can share information about their dates, was hit by a major data hack?
evidence: The controversial US-based app, designed to help women navigate the dating world safely, confirmed that tens of thousands of women's photos and IDs had been accessed. Within hours of the breach, a now-deleted 4chan thread shared a custom Google map that claimed to tie images to women's locations.

question_sentence: What nonprofit online organisation has been given federal status by the US government?
evidence: The US Senate has granted federal status to the Internet Archive, officially making it part of a massive library network that the public can access. The nonprofit organisation is best known for its collection of archived digital data, including websites, software and music.

question_sentence: Which US clothes retailer has sparked an online brouhaha over its new ad campaign, featuring actress Sydney Sweeney and a controversial pun?
evidence: The ad shows the "Euphoria" star describing her "genes" before explaining that her American Eagle "jeans" are blue. Some critics decried the seeming celebration of traditionally "Aryan" looks – white, blonde hair and blue eyes – as unsettling in the current fraught US political climate.

question_sentence: What magnitude was the recent earthquake that occurred off Russia’s far-eastern Kamchatka Peninsula?
evidence: A powerful magnitude 8.8 earthquake off Russia's far-eastern Kamchatka Peninsula on Tuesday triggered tsunami waves across the Pacific Ocean. Russia said the shallow quake caused damage in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky and elsewhere on the peninsula and flooded the Kuril Islands with waves as high as 19 feet.

question_sentence: Which politician has decided against running for governor of California in 2026?
evidence: “For now, my leadership — and public service — will not be in elected office,” former Vice President Kamala Harris announced this week.

question_sentence: Which once popular diet food is making a comeback thanks to TikTok?
evidence: Cottage cheese sales are on the rise thanks to young, protein-hungry consumers who have whipped up new recipes and posted them online, creating an internet sensation.

question_sentence: An earthquake off the coast of which country triggered tsunami waves that reached the US West Coast?
evidence: A massive 8.8 magnitude earthquake that struck off Russia’s far eastern coast this week triggered tsunami waves that coursed across the Pacific.

question_sentence: Which country just announced that YouTube will soon be banned for children under 16?
evidence: The Australian government said YouTube will be subject to the same rules as other social media platforms under legislation due to come into effect in December.

question_sentence: What caused a Delta Air Lines flight from Salt Lake City to Amsterdam to make an emergency landing in Minnesota?
evidence: More than two dozen people aboard Flight DL56 were taken to the hospital after they were injured by turbulence.

question_sentence: Which of the following is putting newly hatched loggerhead sea turtles on the beaches of Georgia’s Little St. Simons Island in harm’s way?
evidence: Under normal conditions, the soft glow of moonlight guides the baby turtles to the ocean. But this summer, brighter and taller highway lights are disrupting that instinct.

question_sentence: An asteroid that appeared to be on a collision course with Earth may have a new target. Where does it seem to be heading?
evidence: The impact would be a once-in-a-lifetime event for humanity to witness — but it could also send fine-grained lunar material hurtling toward our planet.

question_sentence: What raunchy animated show’s recent premiere was watched by nearly 6 million people?
evidence: The episode of “South Park,” which featured ruthless and profane commentary about President Donald Trump, enjoyed its biggest share of the cable audience for a season premiere since 1999.

question_sentence: What does Evangeline Paredes, who recently celebrated her 109th birthday, credit for her longevity?
evidence: Paredes has dedicated much of her life to public service and volunteerism.

question_sentence: What type of nest was found at a site where the US once made nuclear bombs?
evidence: Employees at the site found a wasp nest with a radiation level 10 times what is allowed by federal regulations. No word yet on whether the wasps developed superpowers ...
